reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Good Emergency Management Practices Development (Phase 1). Ecuador - Georeferencing of Poultry Industry

description.narrative: Support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade.

This award strives to support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade. In addition, this award APHIS is leading a project to develop an application that captures and maps poultry production areas in Ecuador with finer granularity. This project analyzes specific production zones based on commodity. Map tools will be developed to identify risk based on proximity to migratory bird pathways, and will include the ability to document the level of biosecurity on farms and backyard production facilities. This will serve as the foundation for an overall surveillance plan.. This is the second of two workshops on avian influenza. During the first workshop, Ecuador's animal health officials identified several gaps in their development of Good Emergency Management Practices (GEMP) in regards to Avian Influenza via a table top simulation with the Latin American Poultry Association and the World Organisation for Animal Health. This follow-up project will support continued development of surveillance for poultry diseases and emergency and contingency plans for poultry disease outbreaks as well as assist Ecuador's effort to be recognized as free of avian influenza. (This project was originally scheduled for 2020 and was rescheduled due to COVID 19.).

participating-org.narrative: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service
The federal government of the United States

participating-org.usg:office-name: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: In response to restrictions imposed by the Ecuadorian government, USAID closed its mission on September 30, 2014. Additionally, International Military Education and Training (IMET) and Foreign Military Financing (FMF) assistance halted and remaining funds were reallocated when the Ecuadorian government terminated bilateral military cooperation and asked the U.S. Embassy to end military cooperation operations by April 30, 2014. The United States will continue to promote the development of sustainable institutions and processes in Ecuador for democracy, human rights, and the rule of law. U.S. assistance will support civil society and freedom of expression in Ecuador.
